tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

name.native: イエロー キーパー

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/negi_haruba)

Negi Haruba graduated from the manga department of Trident College of Design in 2013. He won an award in the 89th Weekly Shounen Magazine Newcomer Manga Award organized by Kodansha with the one-shot manga *Coward Cross World*. The work was published in Magazine SPECIAL 2013 as his debut.

In 2014, he won a Gold Award for the one-shot *Ura Sekai Communication* in the 21st Dengeki Grand Prize sponsored by KADOKAWA and ASCII Media Works. This work was later published in Weekly Comic Dengeki Daioh magazine in September 2014.

On January 25, 2017, wrote yet another one-shot, titled *5-toubun no Hanayome*. Receiving positive responses for his work, an official serialization of the one-shot was announced and published in Weekly Shounen Magazine on August 9, 2017. A year later, the manga series was announced to get an anime adaptation on August 8, 2018, and to be aired on TBS from January 1, 2019. A second season started airing January 8, 2021.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Orange Range is a 5-member Japanese alternative rock band, based in Okinawa. Formed in 2001, the band began with Spice Music and later signed with Sony Music Japan's gr8! records division in 2003.  (Source: Wikipedia)
__Mika Akitaka__ is a Japanese illustrator, game creator and character, mechanical and prop designer
Founder and representative director of Otonarium.
